The following motion chart shows data compiled by the [Quality of Government
Institute](http://qog.pol.gu.se/data/datadownloads/qogbasicdata). It includes
various measures of political contestation, constraints, democracy, and quality
of governance indicators.


```{r setup, include=FALSE}
# Load packages
library(rio)
library(dplyr)
library(googleVis)

# Load data
main <- import('/git_repositories/qog_motion_chart/qog_bas_ts_jan15.csv')

# Keep variables of interest
sub <- main %>% select(cname, year, ht_region, cam_contest, cam_inclusive, chga_demo, 
              h_polcon3, iaep_evp, iaep_lvp, p_polity2, uds_median,
              ti_cpi, wbgi_gee, wbgi_rle, gle_rgdpc)

names(sub) <- c('Country', 'Year', 'Region', 'Political Contestation', 'Political Inclusiveness', 
                'Binary Democracy', 'Political Constraints', 'Executive Veto Power',
                'Legislative Veto Power', 'Polity Democracy Score', 
                'Unified Democracy Score', 
                'Corruption Perceptions Index', 'Government Effectiveness',
                'Rule of Law', 'Real GDP per capita')

sub$Region <- factor(sub$Region, levels = 1:10, 
                     labels = c('Eastern Europe/Soviet Union',
                                'Latin America',
                                'North Africa/Middle East',
                                'Sub-Saharan Africa',
                                'Western Europe/North America',
                                'East Asia',
                                'South-East Asia',
                                'South Asia',
                                'The Pacific',
                                'Caribbean'))
```

```{r motionchart, echo=F, message=FALSE, results='asis'}
# Create motion chart
motion <- gvisMotionChart(sub, idvar = 'Country', timevar = 'Year', 
                          colorvar = 'Region', sizevar = 'Real GDP per capita',
                          xvar = 'Unified Democracy Score', 
                          yvar = 'Electoral Contestation')
plot(motion)
```
